Account Payables Officer Job at Emzor Pharmaceutical Industries Limited




        
    

        
        Emzor Pharmaceutical Industries is one of Nigeria's leading pharmaceutical companies, dedicated to providing premium, affordable medical treatments. We have been manufacturing pharmaceutical and health products for over 40 years. We are promoting unlimited wellness by offering innovative, long-lasting medical solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Payables Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary
     

            
    




	The Accounts Payable Officer is responsible for processing supplier invoices, ensuring timely and accurate payments, maintaining vendor accounts, and supporting financial controls in line with company policies and accounting standards.


Key Responsibilities 
Invoice Processing & Payments:


	Verify and process supplier invoices accurately and on time.
	Perform 3-way matching (PO, GRN, Invoice) where applicable.
	Prepare and process payment runs (bank transfers, cheques, electronic payments).
	Ensure adherence to agreed payment terms and cash flow planning.


Vendor Management:


	Reconcile vendor accounts and resolve discrepancies.
	Respond to vendor queries and manage payment-related communications.


Accounting & Reporting:


	Post AP transactions accurately in the ERP/accounting system.
	Reconcile the AP sub-ledger with the general ledger.
	Assist with month-end and year-end closing activities.
	Prepare AP ageing reports and analysis.


Compliance & Controls:


	Ensure compliance with internal controls, approval workflows, and delegation of authority.
	Support internal, external, and statutory audits.
	Ensure compliance with tax requirements such as withholding tax and VAT


Process Improvement & Support:


	Identify opportunities to improve AP processes and efficiency.
	Support automation and ERP enhancements.
	Maintain proper documentation and records.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree or Higher National Diploma in Accounting, Finance, or a relevant field.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in Accounts Payable
	A professional qualification (ICAN or ACCA equivalent) is an added advantage.


Key Competencies:


	High level of integrity, accuracy, and attention to detail.
	Good problem-solving skills
	Good understanding of AP processes and controls
	Time management and the ability to meet deadlines.


Benefits


	Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
	A supportive and dynamic work environment with clear career growth opportunities.
	Comprehensive medical insurance, pension, and other employee benefits.

Facility Manager Job at  Emzor Pharmaceutical Industries Limited




        
    

        
        Emzor is a leading pharmaceutical company in Nigeria, with over 40 years of excellence in manufacturing high-quality, affordable, and innovative medical products. Our mission is to promote Unlimited Wellness by providing long-lasting healthcare solutions that improve lives.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Facility Manager
Job Location: Sagamu, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Mode: Onsite

Role Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a skilled and experienced Facility Manager that will be responsible for the smooth day-to-day operations and maintenance of Emzor’s pharmaceutical manufacturing facilities.
	Your role ensures safety, functionality, compliance, and optimal use of infrastructure and services.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee daily and preventive maintenance of infrastructure (plumbing, lighting, utilities, etc.)
	Ensure optimal functioning of non-production systems – generators, compressors, water supply
	Coordinate with security, janitorial, fumigation, and landscaping teams
	Monitor cleanliness and functionality of restrooms, canteens, break rooms
	Maintain detailed logs of maintenance activities, utilities, and contractor services
	Enforce compliance with SOPs, HSE guidelines, NAFDAC, and NESREA regulations
	Support audits by preparing facility-related reports and documentation
	Supervise vendors, enforce SLAs, and monitor costs and facility-related budgets


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Estate Management, Business Administration, or a related field
	Minimum 5 years of experience in facility or general services management (preferably in Pharma or FMCG)
	NEBOSH/HSE certification is an added advantage
	Membership in a facility management body is a plus.


Key Competencies:


	Strong understanding of facility operations and safety compliance
	Excellent communication, supervision, and documentation skills
	Budget planning and vendor management experience.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
	A supportive and dynamic work environment with clear career growth opportunities.
	Comprehensive medical insurance, pension, and other employee benefits.

  "description": "Emzor Pharmaceutical Industries is one of Nigeria&#39;s leading pharmaceutical companies, dedicated to providing premium, affordable medical treatments. We have been manufacturing pharmaceutical and health products for over 40 years. We are promoting unlimited wellness by offering innovative, long-lasting medical solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Engineering Procurement Specialist
Job Location:&nbsp;Ilupeju,&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The role is responsible for bridging engineering, production teams and external suppliers, managing strategic sourcing of technical, production, administrative, and IT requirements, overseeing engineering projects and factory services, handling contract negotiations and supplier relationships, and ensuring GMP compliance, cost efficiency, and quality standards.

Engineering Procurement Specialist Job at Emzor Pharmaceutical Industries Limited




        
    

        
        Emzor Pharmaceutical Industries is one of Nigeria's leading pharmaceutical companies, dedicated to providing premium, affordable medical treatments. We have been manufacturing pharmaceutical and health products for over 40 years. We are promoting unlimited wellness by offering innovative, long-lasting medical solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Engineering Procurement Specialist
Job Location: Ilupeju, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The role is responsible for bridging engineering, production teams and external suppliers, managing strategic sourcing of technical, production, administrative, and IT requirements, overseeing engineering projects and factory services, handling contract negotiations and supplier relationships, and ensuring GMP compliance, cost efficiency, and quality standards.


Responsibilities
Technical Sourcing & Procurement Execution:


	Interpret technical specifications with Engineering and Production teams.
	Source, evaluate, and qualify vendors while conducting technical bid assessments.
	Manage PR, RFQ, negotiation, PO creation, and contract award processes.


Vendor Management & Compliance Oversight:


	Ensure supplier pre-qualification and regulatory compliance (SON, NAFDAC, ISO, cGMP, etc.).
	Monitor vendor performance on delivery, quality, and service levels.
	Conduct periodic supplier audits in collaboration with QA.


Cost Optimization & Supply Planning:


	Negotiate pricing, payment terms, and warranties to optimize TCO.
	Analyze market trends and identify cost-saving sourcing alternatives.
	Coordinate reorder levels and align specifications with users to ensure timely and efficient supply.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree or HND in Mechanical Engineering or Industrial Engineering.
	3-7 years of experience in procurement or supply chain management, specifically within the Pharmaceutical, FMCG, or Biotech industries.
	Exposure to purchasing engineering and quality equipment
	Knowledge of HVAC systems and water treatment plants are highly preferred.


Key Competencies: 


	Understanding of industrial spares and general engineering, has knowledge of cleanroom requirements.
	Proficiency in ERP systems (Oracle) and Advanced Excel
	Moderate understanding of contracts and ability to negotiate service level agreements (SLAs).
	Ability to interpret engineering drawings and technical data sheets.


What we offer


	Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
	A supportive and dynamic work environment with clear career growth opportunities.
	Comprehensive medical insurance, pension, and other employee benefits.
